properties.headline: City2Surf - SYDNEY CBD TO BONDI BEACH William St, New South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd, Military Rd & Campbell Pde
properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is covered for participants & volunteers. Buses between the city and the Eastern Suburbs will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Significant road closures and widespread parking restrictions will be in place between the Sydney CBD and Bondi Beach while up to 70,000 people take part in the 14km City 2 Surf fun run.

Roads close from 3.30am in the city, with major closures along the course from 6am between Woolloomooloo and Edgecliff and from 7am between Double Bay and Bondi. Roads start reopening from 11.30am in the city then between 1pm and 2pm in the east. Roads at Bondi Beach remain closed until 4pm.

MAJOR ROAD CLOSURES

  • Sydney CBD between 3.30am and 12pm: sections of College St, Macquarie St, St James Rd, Park St and William St.
  • Woolloomooloo to Edgecliff from 6am to 12pm: William St from Yurong St through to New South Head Rd at Ocean Ave. No access to the city via New South Head Rd west of Ocean St until 12pm, alternate route via Oxford St.
  • Double Bay to Rose Bay from 7am to 1pm: New South Head Rd from Ocean Ave to Dover Rd.
  • Rose Bay to North Bondi from 7am to 2pm: New South Head Rd from Dover Rd to Old South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd from New South Head Rd to Oceanview Ave and Military Rd from Old South Head Rd to Blair St.
  • Bondi Beach between 6am and 4pm: Campbell Pde from Hall St to Blair St from 6am. Campbell Pde from Dudley St to Hall St and Lamrock Ave from 7am.
  • Bondi Junction from 9.30am to 3pm: sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St and Oxford St. Bondi Rd will also be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Motorists are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd.

Vehicle crossover points will be maintained at specific locations along the course until 7am and 7.15am, once the course is locked down there is no vehicle crossing until roads reopen. It is a fineable offence to drive on or exit a driveway onto a closed road. Pedestrian crossing is permitted when there are safe gaps between runners.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect along both sides of the entire 14km course this year from 1am to 12pm from the city to Rose Bay and from 1am until 4pm along the remainder of the course to Bondi Beach.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and also apply to local residents with parking permits and TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Cycleways will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal.   

BONDI BEACH FROM 6AM TO 4PM                

  • Lamrock Ave between Campbell Pde and Sir Thomas Mitchell Rd westbound

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle course crossover points:

Crossover points along the course will be maintained for local access until 7am or 7.15am, depending on the location. After these times there will be no vehicle access permitted while the run is underway until roads have safely reopened to traffic.  

  • Woolloomooloo: Crown St at William St two-way crossover open until 7:15am
  • Darlinghurst: Victoria St / Darlinghurst Rd and Ward Ave crossover (remains open throughout event). Access to Cross City Tunnel and Craigend St (westbound only) is maintained via McLachlan Ave only.
  • Darling Point: Exit only one-way from New Beach Rd to Neild Ave open until 7am
  • Edgecliff: Exit only one-way from Ocean Ave to Ocean St open until 7:15am
  • Double Bay: Exit only one-way from Cross St to Bellevue Rd until 7:15am
  • Vaucluse: Towns Rd / Vaucluse Rd at New South Head Rd two-way crossover open until 7:15am
  • Vaucluse/Watsons Bay: Exit only one-way from Old South Head Rd at New South Head Rd until 7:15am
  • North Bondi/Bondi Beach: Exit only one-way from Brighton Blvd and Ramsgate Ave at Campbell Pde open until 7am  

Local access

Bondi Rd will be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Local residents are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd.

Residents north of Bondi Rd should use Old South Head Rd to enter or exit the area. Residents south of Bondi Rd should use Birrell St. ·        Local access for residents at Bondi Beach will be maintained via Curlewis, Gould and Hall Streets

properties.headline: Sydney Harbour 10k & 5k - SYDNEY CBD, THE ROCKS, MILLERS POINT, BARANGAROO & PYRMONT George Street, Hickson Road, Pirrama Road
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney CBD & Pyrmont road closure map - Sydney Harbour 10k & 5k
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney CBD & Pyrmont road closure map - Sydney Harbour 10k & 5k

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k will be taking place on Sunday 24 July. Events start from George St at the Overseas Passenger Terminal in The Rocks from 7am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the fun run road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4:30am to 10:30am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd and Hickson Rd from George St to The Park Hyatt. Upper Roadway from Hickson Road to OPT. 
  • 4:30am to 12:30pm: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.
  • 5:30am to 9:30am: Sussex St northbound from King St to Erskine St, Sussex St between Napoleon St and Erskine St including Slip St and Hickson Rd from Watermans Quay to Napoleon St.
  • 5:30am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Watermans Quay and Town Pl, Napoleon St and Barton St.
  • 5:30am to 10:30am: Hickson Rd from Towns Pl to The Park Hyatt, Dalgety Road and Towns Place.
  • 7am to 9:30am: Roads around Pyrmont including Murray St between Darling Dr and Pirrama Rd, Pirrama Rd between Murray St and Jones Bay Rd and Wharf 7 & 10 access roads
  • From 8am to 9am there will be no exit from Barangaroo Ave, Cuthbert St, King St, Lime St and Shelley St at King St Wharf due to closures on Sussex Street. Access via Harbour St/Wheat Rd. 

Changed local access arrangements will be in place in Pyrmont, King St Wharf and Barangaroo precincts.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in effect however all vehicles, including cars and motorcycles, parked on roads that are closed for the event will not be able to move or exit the area until roads have safely reopened.

FROM 5:30AM to 9:30AM

  • Slip Street From Sussex Street
  • Sussex Street Between Napoleon Street and Erskine Street
  • Sussex Street Between King Street and Erskine Street (Northbound)

FROM 5:30AM TO 10:00AM

  • Barton St From Hickson Rd
  • Hickson Road Between Watermans Quay and Towns Place
  • Napoleon Street Between Kent Street and Sussex Street          

FROM 5:30AM to 10:30AM

  • Dalgety Road Between Windmill Street and Towns Place

  • Towns Place Between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road    

PYRMONT

FROM 7:00AM TO 09:30AM

  • Pirrama Road 2 Between Murray Street and Jones Bay Road
  • Wharf 7 & 10 access road 3 From Pirrama Road

Notes:

  1. No access to or from Australian National Maritime Museum.
  2. Exit only from The Star carpark northbound on Pirrama Road. Access to Star Casino via Edward St.
  3. Exit only until 8.00am northbound on Pirrama Road.

CYCLEWAY CLOSURE

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8AM to 9AM

  • King Street 1 Between Kent Street and Sussex Street

Notes:

  1. Cycleway detour from Pyrmont Bridge to Kent Street and vice versa via Market Street road bridge.

SHARED PATHWAY CLOSURE - SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8AM to 9AM

  • King Street off ramp Between Pyrmont Bridge and Sussex Street pathway closed.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures &  shared pathway closures

arrangementElements.html:
CHANGED ACCESS ARRANGEMENTS DURING CLOSURE PERIODS:

King St Wharf: between 8am and 9am access to King St Wharf is via Wheat Road only. There will be no entry or exit via Erskine St during this time due to closures on Sussex St for the event. Vehicles entering the precinct need to be aware they cannot exit until after 9am when roads reopen. 

Pyrmont: between 7am and 9:30am access into The Star car park will not be available via Pirrama Rd. Access via Pyrmont St, Jones Bay Rd, or Edward St instead. Vehicles may exit the car park onto Pirrama Rd (northbound only) under traffic control until 8:00am. No access to or from Australian National Maritime Museum during these times.
arrangementElements.title: Local access arrangements

properties.headline: Special event - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Disney On Ice at Qudos Bank Arena from Wednesday 13 until Sunday 17 July. Shows start daily from 10:30am.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Bastille Festival - CIRCULAR QUAY Alfred Street and Loftus Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.adviceB: Allow extra travel time; Use public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Bastille Festival with events running from 12pm-10pm Thursday, 10am-11pm Friday and Saturday, and 10am - 8pm on Sunday.

The festival will be held at various locations around Circular Quay including Customs House (on Alfred St), Loftus St and the Gateway Plaza Forecourt areas.

No road closures will be in place for the event but motorists should exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads in the area throughout the festival and allow extra travel time.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Penrith Panthers at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 2pm and full-time around 3:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Rabbitohs at Accor Stadium. NRL Kick-off from 6:15pm, full-time around 8pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are urged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Adelaide Crows at the SCG. First bounce from 1:45pm and full time at approx. 4:25pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am until 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 11AM TO 6PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Broncos at CommBank Stadium. NRL kick-off from 7:50pm and full-time around 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close from approx. 9:30pm until 10:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue: 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Titans at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 2pm and full-time around 3:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Sea Eagles at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm and full-time approx. 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Roosters at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 7:55pm and full time approx. 9:55pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Sharks at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full-time approx. 7:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Storm at Accor Stadium. NRL Kick-off from 7:35pm, full-time around 9:20pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are urged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT - Summit Shoalhaven - KANGAROO VALLEY Moss Vale Road at Mount Scanzi Road
properties.otherAdvice:
Summit Shoalhaven, aka King of the Mountain, will be run in 2022 by Elite Energy. The off-road running event up Mount Scanzi will incorporate 55km, 40km, 23km and 13km events, catering for the full spectrum of runners from elite to the weekend warrior.

Traffic control will be in place on Moss Vale Road at Mount Scanzi Road and the entrance to Osborne Park Kangaroo Valley Showground.

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse from 11am.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - BROOKVALE Pittwater Road at Brookvale Oval
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Knights at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 5:30pm, full-time around 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Dragons. Kick-off from 3pm and full-time approx. 5pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 1pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Rugby Union - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

arrangementAttachments.fileName: SCO_1080_MOORE PARK WALK_17DEC21_NO SHUTTLES OR EP2.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Rugby Union: Wallabies v England at the SCG. Starts at 7:55pm and full time at approx. 9:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5pm before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Chalmers St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.headline: Sutherland2Surf Fun Run and Walk - SUTHERLAND TO CRONULLA via the Kingsway
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting around the closures. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Cronulla road closure map - Sutherland to Surf

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 7,000 participants will take part in the annual Sutherland 2 Surf fun run and walk from Sutherland to Cronulla via the Kingsway from 7.30am. Roads around the start area will close from 5am with all closures in place by 7.40am. Roads progressively reopen from 8.20am, with all roads reopened by 10:30am.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Sutherland from 5am: sections of Flora St and Acacia Rd.
  • Gymea to Cronulla from 7am to 10am: the eastbound lanes of the Kingsway will be closed from the Princes Hwy to Elouera Rd, and will progressively reopen from 8.50am. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on the Kingsway westbound lanes from 7am, delays are expected. Motorists travelling north of the Kingsway should use The Boulevarde/Captain Cook Dr. Motorists travelling south of the Kingsway should use President Ave.
  • Kirrawee from 7am: Bath Rd South, Clements Pde and Oak Rd. The Kingsway will be closed in both directions between Talara Rd and the Princes Hwy from 7.20am to 8.20am.
  • Caringbah from 7am: Banksia Rd, Denman Ave and Yathong Rd.
  • Miranda / Caringbah from 7am: southbound lanes of Kiora Rd, Port Hacking Rd and Taren Point Rd.
  • Woolooware from 7am: Dolans Rd, Fowler St and Hughes St.
  • Cronulla from 5am: Mitchell Rd, Elouera Rd and Prince St. While Elouera Rd is closed between 7.30am and 9:50am access to North Cronulla access is via Captain Cook Dr and access to South Cronulla access is via President Ave and Burraneer Bay Rd.

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections including at Hotham Rd, Milburn Rd/Gymea Bay Rd, Sylvania Rd, Wandella Rd, Kiora Rd, Kareena Rd, Taren Point Rd and Gannons Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in place, however vehicles parked along the route cannot be moved while the event is underway. Greenhills car park in Cronulla will be closed from 4pm Sat 16 July until midday Sun 17 July to accommodate the event finish line.

arrangementElements.html:
From 4pm Saturday 16 July to 12 Midday Sunday 17 July: Greenhills Beach car park from the corner of Mitchell Road and Murdock Street, Cronulla.

arrangementElements.html:
KINGSWAY CROSSOVER POINTS:

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections at:

  • Hotham Road before 7:20am and after 8am
  • Milburn Road/Gymea Bay Rd before 7:20am and after 8am
  • Sylvania Road before 7:20am and after 8:200am
  • Wandella Road before 7:20am and after 8:40am

  • Taren Point Road before 7:40am and after 9:10am
  • Gannons Road before 7:40am and after 9:25am
  • Elourea Road before 7:30am and after 9:45am
